fields.description:
Currently, when deactivating a managed account ([https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/deactivate-a-managed-account/]) a default email is sent to that user and it's not possible to customize or disable that email.

This suggestion is for allowing organization administrators to customize or opt-out of this email notification.
fields.summary: Customize account deactivation email notification

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Atlassian Admin, when an administrator removes a user from the site, they are returned to a cached version of the Users list, where the removed user still appears.

It's still possible to click *Show details* for the removed user and the following message:
{quote}There was a problem trying to fetch this users' access.
{quote}
Here, the admin will try to remove the user from the site a 2nd time and receive the following error:
{quote}We couldn't remove the user from the site
{quote}
!example.png|width=509,height=286!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Atlassian Admin > Users under User Management [https://admin.atlassian.com/s/CLOUD-ID/users] 
 # Click *Show details* for the user you want to remove.
 # From the user's overview page, click *. . . > Remove user*
 # Confirm user removal.
 # You receive a confirmation message that the user is removed, but they still appear in the users' list. Click *Show details* next to the user and tries to remove the user again.

h3. Expected Results

Refresh the user list on page reload, reflecting the current state of the users' site access.
h3. Actual Results

The User list does not refresh, and the deleted user still appears in the list.
h3. Workaround

Refresh the Users list page on reload, and the deleted user has been removed.
fields.summary: Removing a user's access from site does not refresh user list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

An unverified account can verified by using the admin api for changing an email address. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Invite a new email address to create an unverified account.
 # Use the org admin api to change the email address of the account to something else. 

{code}
PUT /users/ACCOUNT_ID/manage/email
--data '{"email": "newemail@domain.com"}'
{code}

h3. Expected Results

Similar to doing the change via the org admin interface, the email address should be updated but the account should remain unverified. 

h3. Actual Results

The email address changed and the account gets verified. 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Change email REST API verifies an unverified account

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When an administrator [invites a guest|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/invite-guests-for-external-collaboration/] to a site that does not have a default access group under the *Guests* tab, a generic error message will be displayed:
{quote}Unabel to add USER_EXAMPLE

We couldn't send your invitation. Try inviting that user again.
{quote}
(i) Inviting the user will not work.

By using the browser's console when the issue happens, the following error can be found:
{code:java}
{"key":"noDefaultGroup","context":{"message":"No default group for Product: Product}}{code}
h3. Suggestion

This is a suggestion to improve the error message in order to clarify that the group must be added as a default one under the *Guests* tab so users instead of asking the administrator to try again.
fields.summary: Improve the error message for guest invitations when there are no default access guest groups

fields.description:
Per [the domain verification documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/verify-a-domain-to-manage-accounts/#Verifyadomainforyourorganization-Removeaverifieddomain], when an organization admin un-claims a domain in Atlassian (manually or by un-integrating with GSuite), an email like the one below is fired off to all users under that domain:
{quote}We're writing to let you know that your Atlassian account is no longer managed by your Atlassian Cloud administrator.

This won't change the way you log in to Atlassian products or how you use them.

For more info, see Personal and managed accounts. {quote}

Admins may want the ability to disable those notifications or have them show up in product rather than email end users.
fields.summary: Prevent email notification when removing a domain

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When already verified users attempt to self sign up for a site, they are currently asked to re-verify their email.

h3. Desired Results
Allow users to skip re-verifying their accounts when self signing up for a site.

h3. Actual Results
Users must re-verify their accounts.

h3. Workaround
* Consider using the other methods of [granting users site access|https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/specify-how-users-get-site-access/].
* If you have Atlassian Access, consider [configuring user provisioning|https://support.atlassian.com/provisioning-users/docs/understand-user-provisioning/] to provision users into your site.
fields.summary: Allow verified accounts to skip re-verifying their email when self signing up for a site

fields.description:
h3. Problem description
At the moment, when a user access instance from https://start.atlassian.com/ and he don't have application access , it automatically redirected to JSM Customer Portal ( if there are JSM in the instance). 

h3. Suggestion
It will be best to prompt a pop-up screen to mention the user doesn't have any application access in the instance. Kindly request for access if needed.

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: When customer go to the instance link from https://start.atlassian.com/ and user don't have permission to the instance , show user friendly info that they don't have application access in the instance.

fields.description:
In a few scenarios, customers provide automated access to the user and the user gets added to the default product access group (Ex: confluence-users).

The requirement here is to add those users to synced/provisioned groups as well. 

As of now, the customer has to:
 # Add user manually to AD group after it's added to default product access group.
 # If it's Azure they have to wait for 40mins for the next provisioning cycle to run to sync this user.

The suggestion here is to have some feature that removes this manual work.
fields.summary: Sync group membership from local default group to synced group

fields.description:
When inviting user to JWM project from the assignee field of a Business issue,  the user by default should be invited to either JSW product only, or JSM product only or None. Unless JSW does not exist in the instance in which case the only alternative is to default invite to JSM product.

But what it shouldn't be doing is defaulting invite to both products encouraging inefficient consumption of double licenses, when one would suffice for the required purpose.
fields.summary: Invitation of a JWM user should not have both JSM/JSW selected.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When clicking on "view users" for a specific group from the global permissions page, navigates to the new vortex UI, and the group's section does not load.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to the Jira Global permissions page.
 # Click on "view users" for any groups under any permission.

h3. Expected Results
It should open the group and display the users.

h3. Actual Results
The page does not load.

h3. Workaround

Manually search for the group from the new user management page and check the user membership.
fields.summary: When clicking on "view users" for a specific group from the global permissions page and the group's directory does not load.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a user from an approved domain joins an instance with no default product access, an email is sent to the site-admins specifying that the user now has access to Jira despite them not (nor ever) having access to Jira (or any other products) which understandably causes concern to the site-admins.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Disable product access to all products for new users
 # Setup an approved domain for access
 # Have a user sign up for access under that domain
 # site-admins receive a notification about that user having access to Jira
 # No product access has been granted to the user at all

h3. Expected Results
The email doesn't specify that the user has been added to Jira unless they have been.

h3. Actual Results
The email specifies that that the user has been granted site access and Jira product access.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: "A new teammate has joined your product" email specifies incorrect information about users product access

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The "Edit description" menu for groups is enabled for Vortex Organizations with user provisioning. However when you edit the description here it gives an error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to any Vortex Organization wiith user provisioning.
 # The 'Edit description' menu is enabled for the provisioned groups.
 # When you click this menu it will give an error "Unable to edit group description"

Please check the attached screenshots once.

h3. Expected Results

The 'Edit description' menu for provisioned groups should be disabled for Vortex Organizations. 

h3. Actual Results

The 'Edit description' menu is enabled for the provisioned groups in a Vortex Organization. If you edit the description here, it will throw an error.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The "Edit description" menu for groups is enabled for Vortex Organizations with user provisioning. However when you edit the description here it gives an error.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When any Atlassian account has the default profile picture of name initials, a Gravatar tracking cookie is called to display the profile picture.

Tracking cookie: [https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/594cf636ffb496c2624ebe43eb838ed1/] " followed by a gravatar hash"

Disable this fallback to gravatar profile picture when there is no custom profile picture set.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Leave Atlassian account with the default profile picture which has name initials 
 # login to any Atlassian product, and you shall see Gravatar cookies in the browser console
 # This is expected due to the Fallback mechanism of how our account profile pictures are handled.
 # When there is no customer profile picture, a Gravatar has associated with the email id replaces the profile with the name initials, which we see as the default profile picture.

h3. Expected Results

With the default profile picture, there should be no Gravatar cookies detected on the browser
h3. Actual Results

With the default profile picture, Gravatar tracking cookies get detected within the browser.
h3. Workaround

Block the following URL and the gravatar cookies will not be allowed on the browser

([https://*.gravatar.com)|https://%2A.gravatar.com%29/] or ([https://secure.gravatar.com|https://secure.gravatar.com/]
fields.summary: Disable Fallback of profile picture to name Initials (default profile picture) provided by Gravtar.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* Users are reporting that their their time-zone has been set to GMT 0 (UTC) in product like Confluencne.
* Checking further, it appears that their time-zone values have been set to blank in their profile.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Check the user's time-zone in product like Confluence, and it would be set to "GMT+0000".
** https://<SITE-NAME>.atlassian.net/wiki/users/viewmysettings.action
# Check the account preferences, and the time-zone field is blank.
** https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences
** This causes issues with apps the rely on the time-zone, like Team Calendar.
*** There's another bug for Team Calendar where it caches the time-zone value, and it takes awhile for the time-zone changes to be picked up by Team Calendar.
** There's also the issue that the daily and weekly update emails are using the UTC time-zone for edit times.

h3. Expected Results
* Customer time-zone values should be set to their correct time-zones that they've set before.

h3. Actual Results
* Customer's time-zone has been updated to blank values.

h3. Workaround
* Manually update the time-zone in account preference.
** https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences
fields.summary: User's time-zone being set to blank and defaulting to UTC (GMT 0) in product

fields.description:
Provide an API that exposes a users' MFA status - i.e. whether they have MFA enabled or not. 

 

Currently, there are no APIs which provide this information.
fields.summary: Expose MFA status via API

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The documentation ‘[Specify how users get site access|https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/specify-how-users-get-site-access]’ has two different section about site access settings. These two sections are separated based on the two different versions (UIs) of Atlassian organizations. These interfaces can be different to each user depending on when they signed up and each one of these screens requires different instructions about the same subject.
Therefore, the product team confirmed that the doc doesn’t have duplicated information. However, it might have potential to be confusing to our customers.

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be nice to add a note or an introduction that explains the existence of two different screens for Atlassian organizations. Also, adding a screenshot of each one could improve the customer experience who will be able to identify which screen they organization currently has when following the steps from the documentation.
fields.summary: Specify different versions of Atlassian in the doc

fields.description: It may be necessary to include the user's email address or name in the body of the invitation email. It is preferable to be able to insert them in a format like Smart Values (ex. user.emailaddress)
fields.summary: Ability to access the value such as an email address when personalizing invitation to a site

fields.description:
h3. Problem description
At the moment, once an account deleted , we update the user name to "Former User". In time , this will affect organization reporting once they have many account deleted in the instance , it is hard to track for issue related to the deleted user.

h3. Suggestion
It will be great to have options for the admin to retain the Name for the deleted user. 

h3. Workaround
Admin needs to keep the deleted user "Account Id" and use the account id to search the issues.
fields.summary: Ability to retain user "Name" in JIRA once the account deleted

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a site-admin revoked the product access of a user, there will be no audit log recorded for the group changes propagated by the action.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a group named "licensed"
 # Add the group to *Jira Software* and *Confluence* as product access
 # Add a user to the "licensed" group
 # Revoke the user's access for *Confluence*
 # Verify the user no longer belongs to the "licensed" group; however, there's no audit log for *user_removed_from_group*

!Screen Shot 2021-09-01 at 15.58.07.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

Output the audit log even when the event is propagated by other operations.
h3. Actual Results

There's no audit log recorded for *user_removed_from_group*.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Group audit log is missing when revoking product access

fields.description:
Currently, when an Atlassian system sends an email to a user (due to a Cloud site invitation, Jira or Confluence notifications, any changes that would be notified via email) there is the possibility that the email will be bounced. When this happens the email address is marked with a bounce and all further emails are blocked. This mechanism is made to prevent Atlassian mail services from being marked as spam by other mail services but currently it is not possible for site/org admins to know when this happens, nor to clear the bounce on Atlassian side and it is required to contact Atlassian Support for this. 

The suggestions are:
* To provide a site/org level function where the admins can see all the managed users in their domain that have a bounce and be able to clear it themselves. 
* Regardless of the implementation of the function from the previous point, send notifications to the admins when a user gets a bounce blocking their emails from Atlassian services.
fields.summary: Allow receiving notifications for when a user has emails blocked.

fields.description:
The Status page APIs to [retrieve users in a group|https://developer.statuspage.io/#tag/users] have been deprecated.

The endpoints are deprecated and will no longer work when all Statuspage accounts are migrated to Atlassian accounts. 
At the moment, the public APIs are not exposed for the StatusPage product. It would be useful to have the APIs to manage users.
fields.summary: REST API call to manage Statuspage users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the Confluence site is open for anonymous users, the spaces that are also open will be accessible to any unauthenticated user from the internet, or unlicensed authenticated users.

But if the user accesses the page as an anonymous user, then clicks to log in from there, the user will receive either an access denied screen, or the request access screen (depends on the site access configuration).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a Confluence site open to anonymous users with a at least one space also open for anonymous users.
 # Access it while not authenticated to Atlassian.
# Click on the log in icon on the top-right corner of the screen
# Authenticate as you normally do.

h3. Expected Results
User is redirected to the Confluence page they were accessing on the first place.

h3. Actual Results
User receives an access denied page, or a request access to Confluence page.

h3. Workaround
On the same access denied page, click to *Log in with another account* and log in with the same account, you will be redirected to the Confluence page you are trying to access. Or, simply input the same URL for the page as before, it should load with your user authenticated.
fields.summary: Access denied or request access screen displayed to login through public (open for anonymous users) pages in Confluence

fields.description:
When a user tries to access a Site, they are redirected to id.atlassian.com where they have to key in their email and if SSO is enabled, the user then gets redirected to the IDP for Authentication.

Give an option to the Site Admin to enforce a domain hint so when a user tries to access a Site a domain hint like below gets appended to the request so that the user does not have to type their email on id.atlassian.com for SP initiated logins.

https://id.atlassian.com/login?application=statuspage&continue=https://manage.statuspage.io/auth/atlassian?origin=%2Fcloud%2F18094dba-5e8f-4db4-baeb-2a31024c49ba&domain_hint=domain.com

*Points of Concern:*
(*y) In the above case Org Admins will not be able to use the Authentication Policy Feature as all users will get an Enforced SSO login.
(*y) Users from other domain will not be able to join the Sites.
fields.summary: Ability to Auto Detect the Domain on id.atlassian.com
Improve the handling of character limits for group creation in the user management

Log in as user button is greyed out and does not work per https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/log-in-as-another-user/

default groups for new users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When [updating|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-provisioning/rest/api-group-users/#api-scim-directory-directoryid-users-userid-put] a user through [SCIM REST APIs|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-provisioning/rest] the *Organization* attribute/field is not being updated. The Organization attribute should be visible in [the user's personal profile|https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/profile-and-visibility].

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an external directory at https://admin.atlassian.com/ > *Org* > *Directory* > *User provisioning*
# Provision a user as normal.
# With the *Directory ID* and the *API Key* try to run either the [updating|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-provisioning/rest/api-group-users/#api-scim-directory-directoryid-users-userid-put] the user and include the necessary attributes and the organization attribute. Example of request:
{code}curl --request PUT \
  --url 'https://api.atlassian.com/scim/directory/{directoryId}/Users/{userId}' \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <access-token>' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
    "userName": "xyz@your_verified_domain.org",
    "emails": [
      {
        "value": "xyz@your_verified_domain.org",
        "type": "work",
        "primary": true
      }
    ],
    "organization": "SCIM Organization"
  }'
}'{code}

h3. Expected Results
All the attribute will be updated as expected

h3. Actual Results
- Response is successful, but *Organization* attribute is not updated.

h3. Workaround
No available workaround so far for SCIM.

Admins can use the User Management REST API's ["Update profile" endpoint|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-management/rest/api-group-users/#api-users-account-id-manage-profile-patch] in order to help automate an otherwise manual process. Consider [exporting your managed accounts|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/export-managed-accounts/] in order to obtain your user's "account_id"/Atlassian Account Ids in bulk.
fields.summary: Organization attribute is not being set by the SCIM REST APIs

fields.description:
At the moment, admins have to manually manage license removal for inactive Enterprise users.
 # On the org level, admins can deactivate the account and this will free up the licenses taken up by the site.
 # On the enterprise site, admins will need to revoke the Enterprise application license manually. This needs to be done for the same user on multiple Enterprise site in the organization. 

This gets to be a huge effort to free up enterprise/product licenses when there are thousands of accounts and multiple  sites involved. 

*Suggestion* :

Allow policies based on end user inactivity
 * Deactivate accounts that has not been active anywhere for X days
 * Revoke license on site level if the user has been inactive for X days on the application.
fields.summary: Policies for enterprise/product license removal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When requesting access to Confluence, Access requests page incorrectly shows 'Doesn't have access to any products on your site' message even though User already having access to Jira
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new customer group "i.e. Custom Access" and define it as default group to access Jira. Remove jira-software users group.
# Under product access, leave 'New users have access to this product' selected for Jira and de-selected for Confluence.
# Create a new user and access the instance. Click on the product list on the left upper corner and select Confluence (Join). Fill in the access request.

h3. Expected Results

When clicking on review request, Access request should show under account name the message 'Already has access to Jira on your site'
h3. Actual Results

Access request shows under account name when we open the request, 'Doesn't have access to any products on your site'
* Clicking on the user link from the message shows user has access.
* The email that is received shows that the user is 'Already using Jira Software on instance.atlassian.net'

The issue seems to be intermittent, as refreshing the access request page admin.atlassian.com/s/cloud-id/access-requests makes the message sometimes appear correct, and another refresh seems to revert it back to the incorrect one.
 Tested on Chrome Version 91.0.4472.114 and Firefox 91.0 from Mac OS BigSur 11.5.2.
h3. Workaround

Rely on the email request message instead of the message from 'Access requests' page.
fields.summary: When requesting access to Confluence, Access requests page incorrectly shows 'Doesn't have access to any products on your site' message even though User already having access to Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The public name field in https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/profile-and-visibility allows users to enter random characters e.g HTML content, with no validation

 !public-name-with-random-text.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The text should be validated before saving

h3. Actual Results
Allows to save changes with no errors

h3. Workaround
--
fields.summary: User's public name field doesn't validate the characters entered

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When [creating|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-provisioning/rest/api-group-users/#api-scim-directory-directoryid-users-post] or [updating|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-provisioning/rest/api-group-users/#api-scim-directory-directoryid-users-userid-put], [retrieving|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-provisioning/rest/api-group-users/#api-scim-directory-directoryid-users-userid-get] a user through [SCIM REST APIs|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-provisioning/rest] the *Department* attribute/field is not being set/updated.  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an external directory at https://admin.atlassian.com/ > *Org* > *Directory* > *User provisioning*
# With the *Directory ID* and the *API Key* try to run either the [creating|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-provisioning/rest/api-group-users/#api-scim-directory-directoryid-users-post] or [updating|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-provisioning/rest/api-group-users/#api-scim-directory-directoryid-users-userid-put] endpoint. Example of payload:
{code}curl --request PUT \
  --url 'https://api.atlassian.com/scim/directory/<directory-id>/Users/<scim-id>' \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <API Token>' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
  "userName": "wise-mage",
    "emails": [
    {
      "value": "<email-address>",
      "type": "email",
      "primary": true
    }
  ],
  "displayName": "Jack The Grey",
  "department": "Magic Department",
  "organization": "Nowhere Kingdom",
  "timezone": "<string>",
  "active": true
}'{code}

h3. Expected Results
All the attribute will be set/updated as expected

h3. Actual Results
- All attributes are updated but *Department*
!image.png|thumbnail!
- Department can't be retrieved with:
{code}curl --request GET \
  --url 'https://api.atlassian.com/scim/directory/<directory-id>/Users/<scim-id>?attributes=Department' \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <api-token>' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json'{code}
Response:
{code}{"schemas":["urn:ietf:params:scim:api:messages:2.0:Error"],"status":"400","scimType":"invalidValue","detail":"Resource [USER] Attribute \"Department\" is not a valid attribute in returned result."}{code}

h3. Workaround
No available workaround so far for SCIM.

Admins can use the User Management REST API's ["Update profile" endpoint|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-management/rest/api-group-users/#api-users-account-id-manage-profile-patch] in order to help automate an otherwise manual process. Consider [exporting your managed accounts|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/export-managed-accounts/] in order to obtain your user's "account_id"/Atlassian Account Ids in bulk.
fields.summary: Department attribute is not being set/updated/retrieved by the SCIM REST APIs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you authenticate with Google, *Log in with Google enabled* will be displayed on your profile. 

If SSO is later enforced on your account (with a different IDP), this message will still be displayed, even though the user won't be able to log in with Google anymore.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

(on) You'll need to have an SSO integration with an IDP (other than Google) to test this.
 # Create a [managed account|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/managed-accounts-873871203.html] (an account from your [verified domain|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/verify-a-domain-for-your-organization-873871234.html]).
 # Make sure that SSO is not enforced on this account.
 # Use the *Continue with Google* option to authenticate with this account on Atlassian.
 # Access [https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/email]
 # Note that *Log in with Google* will be displayed.
 # Log out of this test account.
 # Now, enforce the SSO authentication on this account.
 # Log in to the test account again, now with SSO.
 # Access [https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/email]

h3. Expected Results

Only *Log in with SAML enabled* should be displayed, since the account is enforced to authenticate with SAML (through the IDP).
h3. Actual Results

Both messages are displayed:
 * *Log in with Google enabled*
 * *Log in with SAML enabled*

!image-2021-08-02-19-44-02-836.png|width=274,height=101!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Accounts that logged in with Google will show Log in with Google enabled even if authentication is enforced with a different IDP

fields.description:
*Description*

Suggestion to have a single signup screen instead of two screens during user signup via invitation.

*Steps to reproduce*

Currently, when a user is invited to an Atlassian site the signup process is completed in two screens.

1) The first screen prompts the user to enter his name and password. The same screen has 'Already has an Atlassian Account login' at the bottom.
 2) In case the user has an Atlassian Account already he will click the link and he will be presented with a screen with different modes of authentication( Google, Microsoft, etc) where he will log in.

Please check Screenshot_invitation_1.png, Screenshot_invitation_2.png, Screenshot_invitation_3.png for the invitation steps.

*Suggested Resolution*

The user experience can be improved by having a single screen for both signup via invitation or direct login. This is because the same screen and fields are available when a customer tries to log in via [https://id.atlassian.com|https://id.atlassian.com/] (General_login_screen.png) also. Another proposal is to verify whether the customer already has an Atlassian Account and show only the relevant fields in the invitation screen.
fields.summary: Suggestion to have a single signup screen instead of two screens during user signup via invitation.

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Users from Atlassian Cloud products can [configure and manage team profiles|https://support.atlassian.com/atlassian-account/docs/manage-team-profiles/#Teamprofiles-Manageyourteamprofile] in order to add [Atlassian accounts|https://support.atlassian.com/atlassian-account/docs/what-is-an-atlassian-account/] and interact with them by using different features.

h3.Suggestion

In situations where multiple members must be added or removed, it is time-consuming to do it manually.

This is a suggestion to have an API for teams so members can perform bulk actions!
fields.summary: API to manage Teams

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Exporting your organization managed accounts fails to generate a CSV file to download via email.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
This bug is only reproducible under the below circumstance:
 # *Have a high amount of managed accounts with NO last active date* (never used any Atlassian Cloud product) - this is reproducible with more than 2800 managed accounts in this circumstance.
 # Try [exporting managed accounts|https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/export-managed-accounts/]

h3. Expected Results
# Email arrives in your email inbox with the link to download the CSV file.

h3. Actual Results
# Email with download link never arrives.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Exporting managed accounts email never arrives

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Some Users are not able to Self Sign-up and Join a Second Product within a Cloud Site 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Enable Self Sign-up within a Cloud Site with Approved Domain(s) and enable Jira and Confluence to be granted to New Users 
# Have a New User join Jira by going to https://instance.atlassian.net 
# Once logged in to the Cloud Site, have the User join Confluence by going to https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki 

h3. Expected Results
The User receives Product Access to both Products 

h3. Actual Results

* If a User Self Signs-up for one product, they are not able to gain the access to the Second; eg if Jira was first, the User is not able to join Confluence (and vice versa)
* In JSM Environments:
** If Confluence was second, the User may be able to view Confluence content but may only be able to view the JSM Customer content  
** If Jira was second, the User would be sent to the JSM Portal 

h3. Workaround

A Site-Admin would need to manually grant Product Access to the User's Second Product
fields.summary: End Users are Unable to Self Sign-up to Join a Second Product in a Cloud Site

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When [SAML SSO|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/saml-single-sign-on-943953302.html] is enabled the users can still use the *Continue with ...* from https://id.atlassian.com to log in. This might allow them to use a different authentication method (OAuth) than what the Org admins want (SAML SSO). 

For example:
# User has a valid Google account with domain @domain.com
# The org admins' configured SAML SSO at Atlassian with Okta
# User will still be able to authenticate with the *Continue with Google* even if SAML is enforced to their account.

h3. Suggested Solutions
Make it possible for the admins to allow/disallow the social login for their managed accounts.
fields.summary: Allow org admins to prevent/block social login for SAML SSO accounts

fields.description:
It would be nice to empower users with the ability to select how their names will show across Atlassian applications regardless of visibility. 

For example, Atlassian accounts created using LDAP have their user's Full Name set by the provider. If the provider uses the user's legal name but the user is known by a different name, then it is not possible to easily change it on the Jira side even though we have a configurable Public Name field. Therefore, please make this field more useful by allowing us to use it across all apps (comments, user picker field, etc) regardless of visibility.
fields.summary: Allow switching between Public Name and Full Name across Atlassian Apps

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If the Slack ID of a given Atlassian Account does not reflect the actual account the user is using at our side. They might face authentication policies errors or be authenticate to the incorrect account.

h3. Example
||Atlassian Account||email||slack id||
|1|abc@domain.com|123|
|2|xyz@domain.com|---|

Atlassian Account got updated to email {{xyz@domain.com}} (at the IdP) but not at Atlassian. So when the user tried to login we will authenticate them with account 2 but Slack ID is still tied to account 1.

h3. Suggested Solutions 
Make it possible for the Org admins to remove the Slack Id directly from the account profile at *Org > Directory > Managed account* OR implement a feature that automatically associates the Slack Id to the new account. 

h3. Current workaround
Open a support ticket
fields.summary: Slack Id breaks the Jira authentication

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a site has the [product access|https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/update-product-access-settings/] configuration with the "New users have access to this product" toggle enabled and the [site access configuration|https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/specify-how-users-get-site-access/] allowing users from a specific domain to automatically join the site, it allows users to have automatic product access as soon as they try to access the instance.

If a user gets Jira access based on this configuration, it will not automatically add the user to Confluence and vice-versa. If this Jira user tries to access a page (via a link, for example), it will not prompt the user to join Confluence.

Instead, the user faces a "Too many redirects" which after some time, redirects the user to a page so they can try again but, it also fails:

!redirects.png|thumbnail!

!almost_there.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Have a site with both Jira and Confluence.
# As an administrator, [update the product access|https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/update-product-access-settings/] to have the "New users have access to this product" toggle enabled.
# Under the [Site access configuration|https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/specify-how-users-get-site-access/], select the *Approve the following domains* option and add a specific domain.
# Have the user from this domain accessing Jira to have the access granted to it, which will not add the user with Confluence access.
# Have this user accessing a page link from Confluence.

(i) During this test, the [landing product|https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/set-your-sites-landing-product/] was configured to Jira.

h3. Expected Results

The user should see the option to join Confluence, like the example from this  test site below:

!welcome_message.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results

The is not able to join the site, even after tapping the *Try again* button:

!redirects.png|thumbnail!

!almost_there.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

To have the product access enabled for the account:

* Have the user manually access the link for Confluence's home (https://site.atlassian.net/wiki)
* Grant site access to the user by accessing the profile under the *User management* tab (found via Confluence's administration/cog icon at the top right > *User management*)
* Have the user accessing Confluence via the application navigator.
fields.summary: New Jira users won't be automatically provisioned to Confluence upon accessing a page link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Incorrect full name set when invited user does not use "Invite link" sent on their mail and logs in directly via social login. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. On inviting a user via email we default to the username provided in the email address. Ex: Sending an invite to [user.test@example.com|mailto:user.test@example.com] will set the username as the user.test
 2. User receives a link to join the site and on clicking the invite link, the user is provided with the option to set user name/ full name.
 3. If the user skips step 2 and logs in to the Atlassian site directly via social login "Continue with Google", we don't provide the option to change the user name in this login flow. Here the user name will be the *user.test*
 4. Option now is org admin changes user name under the managed account or user changes this on his profile at [id.atlassian.com|http://id.atlassian.com/]
h3. Expected Results

Users should be prompted to set Full name on first login or admin should have the option to set Full name while sending invites.
h3. Actual Results

Incorrect full name is set for the user and users believe this full name was by admin for them.
h3. Workaround


Users can change the full name at [https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/profile-and-visibility]

or org admin can change it under managed accounts manually and also via API.
fields.summary: Allow configuring full name if inviting a managed account for the first time

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently we have an issue reported https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/ACCESS-1034 which talks about org level APIs running into an error when we try to fetch the user information for unverified accounts.  This behaviour needs to be fixed on User Management or Identity level as well.

For eg. identify one unverified account and run this API call to fetch the information - 

[https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-management/rest/api-group-users/#api-users-account-id-manage-profile-get]

You will see an error -

{"key":"forbidden.targetUnverified","context":"Error: Cannot perform action on unverified account","errorKey":"forbidden.target-unverified","errorDetail":"Error: Cannot perform action on unverified account"}C02Y723GJG5J

If this is expected, then the API documentation would need to include this point.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run this curl for unverified accounts - 

{code:java}
curl --request GET \
  --url 'https://api.atlassian.com/users/{Account id}/manage/profile' \
  --header 'Authorization:Bearer <org api token>' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json'
{code}

 # The call would fail

h3. Expected Results

API should either fetch some information since it is on user management level or the expected behaviour needs to be mentioned in the page - https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-management/rest/api-group-users/#api-users-account-id-manage-profile-get
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
{"key":"forbidden.targetUnverified","context":"Error: Cannot perform action on unverified account","errorKey":"forbidden.target-unverified","errorDetail":"Error: Cannot perform action on unverified account"}C02Y723GJG5J...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Required, if there is no workaround please state:
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: User Management level API endpoints would throw an error for unverified accounts

fields.description: Make the add-ons profiles manageble so it can be possible to remove them from the instance if they are not in use and also prevent add-on profiles to be created in the site
fields.summary: Ability  to remove and prevent add-on profiles to be added in the site

fields.description:
the customer wants to restrict access to the following API, they don't want the list of dashboards to be public visible
{code:java}
Get all dashboards
GET /rest/api/2/dashboard

Returns a list of dashboards owned by or shared with the user. The list may be filtered to include only favorite or owned dashboards.

This operation can be accessed anonymously.

Permissions required: None.

Connect app scope required: READ

OAuth scopes required: 
read:jira-work{code}
fields.summary: Restrict "/rest/api/2/dashboard" to only users in the instance and not anonymous users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When users/admins face errors when trying to login using [SAML SSO|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/saml-single-sign-on-943953302.html] integration it is unclear how/where they can fix those errors, ending up opening a support ticket for that. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
N/A

h3. Expected Results
Have public documentation to show all possible errors, their causes, and how/where to resolve them.

h3. Actual Results
We have error messages but no clear steps on where/how to resolve them.

h3. Workaround
Create public documentation about the SAML SSO error and, their cause, and how to resolve them.
fields.summary: No public documentation about SAML errors

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The "*Connected apps*" menu did not load under User Management.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on "*User management*" under the site.
 # Then, click on the "*Connected apps*" menu.

[Video|https://share.getcloudapp.com/7KuojPb1] showing this behavior.


h3. Expected Results
It should load the connected app's users, or at least a message showing that it did not have apps connected yet.

h3. Actual Results
The loading icon will continue in a loop without loading the users.

h3. Workaround

After performing a GET using [Jira Cloud for Sheets|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/use-jira-cloud-for-sheets/] the app information load with success: [Evidence.|https://share.getcloudapp.com/ApuzvYDL]

Also, I'd like to emphasize that it seems that this behavior appears under new instances without connected apps.
fields.summary: Connected apps menu did not load under User Management

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you remove the site access from a user and then deactivate it, the status at the user management will be ''No Site Access" instead of the "Account Disabled" at user management.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Remove the site access from a user
 # Deactivate the managed user account at the site Directory,

h3. Expected Results

The account status at the user management should be "Account Disabled"
h3. Actual Results

The user status remains as 'No Site Access".
h3. Workaround
 * Hit the site access checkbox and the status will be updated to "Account Disabled"
fields.summary: Account Status not being correctly displayed at User Management when accounts get deactivated

fields.description: Implement a feature that notifies all org admins when another org admin deactivates or deletes an account and when a site admin removes the product or site access from another account.
fields.summary: Send Notifications to ORG Admins when an account get deactivated or deleted

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Implementation of New Features Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Users may receive an email titled "Unusual login attempts on your Atlassian account", but there's no official public resource describing the notice.
https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/Unusual-login-attempts-on-your-Atlassian-account/qaq-p/1544865

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide documentation to describe how the feature works.

h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Documentation for the unusual login attempts email

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
User count in the billing administration page does not match the user list in the user administration page when you filter by product access.
The specific behavior in the affected instance is that more users are shown as counting towards the billing of confluence that the ones listed when you go to user management and select active users that have product access for it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *Billing > Manage subscriptions* and see the number of billed confluence users
# Go to *User management* and filter the user list by selecting users that have access to confluence
# The number of users will not match and it would seem as if we bill more users than we should

h3. Expected Results
The number of billed users matches with the number of displayed users with product access

h3. Actual Results

The number of billed users is higher

h3. Workaround

Exporting the list of users into a CSV file including the product access information appears to show the right number of users.
fields.summary: User count in the billing administration page does not match the user list in the user administration page

fields.description:
Ability to change the User Role from Trusted to Basic or vice versa in the User Management whether the user has site access or not

For example, a Trusted user who has no site access to be changed to Basic. At moment only users with site access their Role can be changed.
fields.summary: Ability to change the User Role from Trusted to Basic or vice versa in the User Management whether user has site access or not

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Although it states on the group creating screen that admins can edit group descriptions, there's no button available to actually edit a group's description after it's created

!Screen Shot 2021-07-01 at 14.20.13.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce

-
  
h3. Expected Results

According to the linked documentation linked on the groups page "[Learn how to manage groups|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/24xjL]":
{quote} # Go to your site's *Admin* at [admin.atlassian.com|http://admin.atlassian.com/]. If you're an admin for multiple sites or an organization admin, click the site's name and URL to open the *Admin* for that site.
 # Select *Groups* from the navigation menu.
 # Select a group from the list to edit or delete.
 ** Edit the group description by clicking the *Edit description* button.{quote}
h3. Actual Results

No edit button is available.
 !Screen Shot 2021-07-01 at 14.08.55.png|width=613,height=95,thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

No workaround available.

fields.description:
When a user is not active in the site and does not have product access to jira/confluence however they are still active in bitbucket, in such a case, when hovered over the assignee/reporter field, the user does not show inactive rather it will give the details of the user which does not give an idea if the user is active/inactive user of the product.

It would be great to show that the user does not have site access/product access in the same so that we can differentiate if the user is having access to the site or not.
fields.summary: Show the site access details of user when hovered over assignee/reporter field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unverified accounts can be be managed using the admin APIs. The following endpoints cannot be used against unverified accounts. 

{code}
GET /users/{account_id}/manage/profile
PATCH /users/{account_id}/manage/profile
PUT /users/{account_id}/manage/email
POST /users/{account_id}/manage/lifecycle/disable
POST /users/{account_id}/manage/lifecycle/enable
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 
Use the admin API to deactivate an unverified account.

{code}
curl --request POST \
  --url 'https://api.atlassian.com/users/<UNVERIFIED_ACCOUNTID>/manage/lifecycle/disable' \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <ORG_APITOKEN>' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
  "message": "..."
}'
{code}


h3. Expected Results

The unverified account should be deactivated.

h3. Actual Results

Error message returned

{code}
< HTTP/2 403 
{"key":"forbidden.targetUnverified",
"context":"Error: Cannot perform action on unverified account",
"errorKey":"forbidden.target-unverified",
"errorDetail":"Error: Cannot perform action on unverified account"}
{code}

h3. Workaround

Perform the deactivation via the org managed account admin interface if possible.
fields.summary: Admin API cannot be used on unverified accounts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Users don't have a clear understanding of how the *Continue with ...* buttons at https://id.atlassian.com works, how it defers from the regular authentication (email + password), and the implications of using that. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
NA
 
h3. Expected Results
Have public documentation with information on how that OAuth authentication works and how it defers from the regular login. 

h3. Actual Results
No documentation about this.

h3. Workaround
Create new public documentation to clarify that feature to our users.
fields.summary: No public documentation about social login (Continue with ...)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Non-admin users are able to invite new users even if the option to invite new users is disabled
 !Screenshot 2021-06-23 at 13.02.27.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Disable "Existing users can send invitations to anyone" option under *Site access*
 # Go to the *Assignee* field in any issue 
 # Type an email address that does not exist. Invite option will be available to invite.
 !Screenshot 2021-06-23 at 13.04.07.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The option to invite should not be available in the assignee field

h3. Actual Results
The option to invite is available in the assignee field.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Removing site-admin group from Administration access inside *Product access* results in login redirect loop for site-admins accessing Jira settings.

This can result in the two screens below:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

When this is reproduced for Confluence it results in a much more user friendly message:
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access *[https://admin.atlassian.com/] > Product Access > Administration Access*
 # Remove *site-admin* from it
 # Try to navigate to Jira through the *Jira* hyperlink under *Application Settings*

h3. Expected Results
A message should be displayed stating the user can't see the page content because of lack of privileges.

h3. Actual Results
Redirect loop with login occurs in browser requests and pages displayed are not helpful.

h3. Workaround
None at this stage. Once one is identified, we'll add here.
fields.summary: Removing site-admin group from Administration access results in login redirect loop for site-admins accessing Jira settings

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the get users endpoint returns the email address based on the [profile visibility settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2019/07/profile-visibility-settings-are-now-available-on-atlassian-cloud]. Site admins are able to see the email address on the UI and would like to fetch the email address of users using the get users endpoint.

h3. Suggested Solution
Show the email address of the user, when site admins are calling the get users endpoint. 

h3. Why this is important
Site admins developing custom scripts may need to fetch the email address of unmanaged users. The profile visibility settings prevent site admins from fetching the email address that are private.
fields.summary: Allow site admins to fetch email addresses when using the REST API endpoints to get all users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a user has no permission to access Jira, but navigates to it, then Jira redirects to JSS, however, Jira is no longer redirecting to JSS with the permission-violation parameter. Without this parameter, JSS will try to redirect back to Jira. Jira will then redirect to JSS again, in an infinite loop. Eventually, a redirect limit is hit.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Ensure a user does not have access to Jira.
 # Log in as that user.
 # Attempt to access Jira directly, via a URL like [your-subdomain.jira-dev.com/jira|https://jack-redirect-test.jira-dev.com/jira]

h3. Expected Results

The user should be redirected to the request access screen, or account switcher, depending on other settings.
h3. Actual Results

The user redirects several times in a loop, before the redirect limit is hit, and they're shown this screen.

 

!image.png|width=483,height=226!
h3. Workaround

If the user is supposed to be able to request access to Jira, they can be added by an admin.
 Otherwise they can logout manually if they have another account that has access.
fields.summary: Users without product access attempting to access Jira get stuck in an infinite loop

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Deleting the user provisioning directory does not remove All members for directory - <directory_id>" group from the site. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure User provisioning. The group with the name "All members for directory - <directory_id>" will be created at both the org and site levels.
 # Delete user provisioning by removing the user directory at the org level.
 # This deletes the group All members for directory - <directory_id>" group at org level but does not remove group at site level. 

h3. Expected Results

The group should also be removed from the site level as this confuses site admins at times. 
h3. Actual Results

The group is not removed from the site level.
h3. Workaround

Manually delete the group at the site level.
fields.summary: Remove "All members for directory - <directory_id>" group from site when User provisioning is removed

fields.description:
An admin group can grant product access to multiple products. This error message is presented when trying to add a user to a group e.g. administrators and is blocked due to licensing limits on 1 or more products (in most cases I have seen, it is related to Statuspage).

The console returns an error such as:
resourceOwner=statuspage, resourceType=site, resourceId=[REDACTED_ID]}, availableLicencesWithinSoftLimit=-20, availableLicencesWithinHardLimit=-20, requiredSeats=1

We should be able to present this (Statuspage) product that has reached its limit, to the user rather than let them figure out which product is blocking the group addition.
fields.summary: Improve error message when product license limit reached upon adding user to group

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the number of license seats is already exceeded and users have product access via [pushed groups from user provisioning|https://support.atlassian.com/provisioning-users/docs/understand-user-provisioning/], these users can't be added to any additional groups with application access, even though they already consume a license.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure to have a product like Confluence and Jira, with an annual plan to get its license exceeded (monthly plans will automatically upgrade to the next tier).
 # Have a number of users almost reaching the license limit.
 # [Configure user provisioning|https://support.atlassian.com/provisioning-users/docs/understand-user-provisioning/] and [grant product access to the synced groups|https://support.atlassian.com/provisioning-users/docs/configure-user-provisioning-with-an-identity-provider/#Configureuserprovisioning-Configureproductaccessfortheprovisionedgroupsandusers.1]. This will allow the license to be exceeded.
 # For one of the users that already have product access because of the synced groups, try to [add the user to any other local group that already has product access|https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/create-and-update-groups/#Createandupdategroups-Updategroupmembership] (for example, the default access ones).

h3. Expected Results

As the user already has application access, the user should be added to the group without issues.
h3. Actual Results

The following is displayed and the user does not get added to the group(s):
{quote}*Unable to add the user to that group*

You've reached the maximum number of users for your plan. To add this user, upgrade your plan.
{quote}
!add_user.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Besides upgrading the plan or reducing the number of consumed licenses, remove a few users from the externally synced group (via the identity provider), add the users to the desired groups and then, re-add the users to the synced group.
fields.summary: Adding users to groups with product access, when the license is exceeded, results in an error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users without product access are landing on misleading error messages.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 1. Launch a *_Jira Software only_* site
 - Do not enable pre-approved domains for site access
 - Enable access request for approved domain.

 2. Add a user under the domain and grant the product access
 3. As the end user verify that the access is working
 4. Revoke the product access from the user but leave the site access as enabled. 
 5. As the end user try to access the site again via the main URL https://site.atlassian.net

h3. Expected Results

Permission error is returned or access request form should appear

h3. Actual Results

Browser will go on a spinning wheel and will land on the following error. 

{quote}
This page isn’t workingtry-ramon-portfolio.atlassian.net redirected you too many times.
Try clearing your cookies.
ERR_TOO_MANY_REDIRECTS
{quote}


 !error1.png|thumbnail! 

After a while a new error appears in the same tab.

{quote}
You're almost there
It looks like our database is taking a little longer than usual to sync up. Wait a few moments then try again.
If you continue to see this error, raise a support request
{quote}

 !error1.1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Grant the product access to the affected user.
fields.summary: Users without product access are landing on invalid error message

fields.description:
Make the Link at the Join Team button in the welcome mail Editable, or ajust it to redirect the user to the [https://start.atlassian.com/] where users can access products that they have permissions to, 

 

The Join Team button redirect the users to their instance with a URL such as [https://instance.atlassian.net|https://instance.atlassian.net/] which can result in some issues if that user has no permission to access the product that is configured as a landing app
fields.summary: Make the Link at the Join Team button in the welcome mail Editable

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A user deactivated via IDP can be reactivated by org admin without IDP intervention. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Synced a user via OKTA.
 * Deactivated this user via Okta. This deactivated the Atlassian account and marked the SCIM record as false.
 * Marked this user for deletion and canceled deletion via managed accounts.
 * This reactivated the Atlassian account, and the SCIM record was still marked as false. User account stays in the locked state, i.e., managed via IDP.

h3. Expected Results

We should revert the Atlassian account to the previous state on canceling user deletion, i.e., deactivated state. As IDP manages the user account, we should allow reactivation of the account only via IDP. 
h3. Actual Results

User accounts get reactivated, and SCIM record for the same stays inactive. However, the user account still shows managed via IDP under the managed accounts. 
h3. Workaround

Will update the workaround as soon as available.
fields.summary: User deactivated via IDP can be reactivated from org

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* The current default minimum length for an Atlassian account password is 8 characters

h3. Suggested Solution
* Make 12 character passwords the minimum by default

h3. Why this is important
* Improve security for customer data - encourage the use of longer passwords
 
h3. Workaround 
* No known workarounds to enforce a 12 character password minimum length
fields.summary: Atlassian account passwords by default should have a 12 character minimum

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a user is locked out of SAML due to any possible issue, sometimes Atlassian Support sends a one-time login link that bypasses SAML to allow that user to login and un-block them while the investigation is ongoing.
If the user uses Outlook, the link gets encoded by Safelinks and is not usable

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Have a managed account with SAML enabled and using Outlookg for the inbox
 # Step 2 Atlassian Support sends a SAML bypass link via email
# Step 3 The user clicks the link

h3. Expected Results
User is logged-in

h3. Actual Results
User is taken to id.atlassian.com and asked for their email address, then is redirected to the IDP to complete the authentication


h3. Workaround

No known workaround at the moment. Decoding the URL in the email does not seem to work
fields.summary: Using a SAML bypass login link does not work with Outlook

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Provisioned users can be removed on the site level. This leads to groups not being on the same state as provisioned data. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add UserA to GroupA in your AD
 # Provision GroupA to Atlassian 
 # On the site administration, remove UserA manually.  (https://<site>.atlassian.net/admin/users)

h3. Expected Results

UserA should not be allowed to be removed on the site level or there should be an org level feature to sync the missing user back on the site. 

h3. Actual Results

UserA can be removed. 

h3. Workaround

Remove and re-add the user to the provisioned groups on the AD.
fields.summary: Provisioned users can be removed on the site level

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Identity provider(IdP) initiated authentication for Azure AD doesn't work if SAML doesn't work if the "Atlassian Cloud" Azure AD app is configured as per the documentation: [Atlassian Cloud tutorial: Configure Azure AD SSO|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/saas-apps/atlassian-cloud-tutorial#configure-azure-ad-sso].
h3. Environment
 * SAML configured with Azure AD as the IdP

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure SAML as per the [instructions here|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/saas-apps/atlassian-cloud-tutorial#configure-azure-ad-sso]
 # Your config should look something like this:
 !screenshot-1_edited.png|thumbnail!
 # Save the configuration
 # Try logging in via myapps.microsoft.com

h3. Expected Results
 * You're logged into the instance.  In our example, that instance would be "dnguyen4-test-instance.atlassian.net"

h3. Actual Results
 * The login process is stuck at the [https://id.atlassian.com|https://id.atlassian.com/] site
 * Redirection to the instance does not occur and the SAML login process stops here:
 !Screenshot 2019-09-30 at 10.37.53.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
 * Documentation is out of date, but the root cause of the problem may be due to changes in Atlassian Identity or the "Atlassian Cloud" Azure AD app maintained by Microsoft
 * The current redirection flow is (IdP) > id.atlassian.com > start.atlassian.com > (Cloud instance). The "Atlassian Cloud" Azure AD app may not be considering the redirect to "start.atlassian.com" or similar scenario

h3. Workaround

On the SIngle Sign On configurations in Azure. 

 !saml.png|thumbnail! 

- Remove the value for *Sign on URL* and leave it empty.
- Set the *Relay State* to your cloud site URL https:// *.atlassian.net site or https://start.atlassian.com
fields.summary: SAML: Azure AD(IdP) initiated auth doesn't work if configured as per Azure AD documentation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When changing a managed account email address the event is not being logged in the Organization's Audit Log (https://admin.atlassian.com/ > Org > Security > Audit log). 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to your Org > Directory > Managed accounts
# Access one account and update it to a new email address, i.e. from abc@domain.com to abcd@domain.com
# The change will be applied but won't be logged at the Audit Log.

h3. Expected Results
The email change would be logged at the Audit Log i.e. 
{{email change from abc@domain.com to abcd@domain.com}}

h3. Actual Results
Nothing is logged there nor in the CSV file you can export. 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Email change is not being logged at the Organization's audit log

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Site admins wich never used some products are not displayed as licensed users when looking at the Manage subscriptions or when searching for it by filtering by-products at user management.

Example: A instance has 10 users wich 2 of them are site admins that never used Confluence, when going to the Manage subscriptions settings, it will display only 8 licensed users when in fact they are using 10 licenses for that product because the other 2 are site admins wich automatically have a licence so each product on that instance

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Assing some users as Site Admins
 # Check if they are listed at Manage subscriptions or when performing a search that contains a product filter enable

h3. Expected Results
All the users that have a license enabled for that product should be displayed, regardless of being part of the default access group or not, being a site admin or not, have using the product or not.

h3. Actual Results
Not all licensed users for that product are displayed, only users that are part of the default access group or site admins that have used the product in the past, licensed site admins that never used that product won't be listed

h3. Workaround
Check at the global permissions setting where all site admins and org admins can be seen and try to identify which of them are the ones that are missing at the manage subscription setting.
fields.summary: Site Admins Licenses are not being Displayed at Manage Subscriptions

fields.description:
As a Jira/Confluence admin , I would like to have an automated system to check the inactive account over a period of time and deactivate that account if it is inactive for certain period so that the user licenses can be utilized properly. 

 

The way it should work is:

1. Check the number of inactive users for a particular period (say inactive for last 3 months).
2. Send these users a mail notifying that there is no activity on user account for 3 month and we will be deactivating the account after 30 days if there is no activity.
3. Deactivate the users, one month or a week after notification is sent, if they are still inactive. 
4. Delete the deactivated users after few days of deactivation.
fields.summary: Delete inactive user based on activity

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-3740].
  {panel}

It would be nice if JIRA was able to send out mails when new users sign up or are removed.

This is mostly useful for projects with many members where you need to assign groups to developers after they've signed up. 

If the email could include links to the edit user / edit user groups pages it would be even more useful :)

UPDATE: This feature request should also cover when new users are created or removed by anyone in the application. It would be helpful as if a site has multiple site-admins, it would alert the others when a user is created, as well as if users are created via an external system import.
fields.summary: Notification event to signal new user sign-up / account creation / user removal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26762].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 21 December 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hello All,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; however there are not currently any plans to implement this suggestion.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Arigato,
Otto Ruettinger
Principal Product Manager, JIRA
oruettinger (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}

Would like a way to sync Active Directory User pictures with the according account in JIRA for the profile picture.

fields.description:
h3.Summary

By default, the user profiles [found on the People part|https://support.atlassian.com/atlassian-account/docs/search-for-people-and-teams/] have default information displayed, which will be retrieved from the [Atlassian account|https://support.atlassian.com/atlassian-account/docs/what-is-an-atlassian-account/].

h3.Suggestion

As the displayed information can't be customized to include additional fields, this is a suggestion to allow the users and admins to personalize the displayed content.

For example, adding a quick description of who's the user, audio files to share the user's name pronunciation, links to introduction blogs.
fields.summary: Ability to include custom information to user profiles

fields.description:
As a Site Admin I would like to be able to send an automated message to users who are requesting access to the instance.

Use Case:

We would like to send an automated message to users requesting site access informing them about the correct on-boarding process followed by the organization.
fields.summary: Allow Site admins to configure an auto reply Message when users request access to the instance

fields.description:
Organization administrator should have an ability to clear active session individually for managed users.

Use case : We understand that when 2FA is enforced, it does not kill the active session but waits for user to log out and then prompt to set up 2FA, but in cases where users password is cached , the only way left with org admins is to have them clear cache from browser or log in incognito mode ( where password is not saved)

Reference : https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/enforce-two-step-verification/
fields.summary: Organization administrator should have an ability to clear active session individually.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When attempting to invite a deactivated user to a Cloud site, the error message simply states: "We couldn't send your invitation. Try inviting that user again."

The reason could be made more clear, since it is not always known beforehand that a particular user is deactivated.
h3. Suggested Solution

Update the interface to include a statement that the user could not be invited because of their deactivated status.
h3. Workaround

You can get more information about why a user can't be invited by checking your browser's network log and inspecting the response for the /invite endpoint. The server's response will be something like:
{code:json}
{"key":"badRequest","context":{"message":"Not all users have active AtlassianId account"}}{code}
fields.summary: Inviting a deactivated user to a site is not explicit enough

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement:

On open instances where anyone can join, create and comment on issues/pages, there's no way for admins or other members to report a user as spammy so that it can be investigated and have the Atlassian Account blocked if needed. Currently, once an admin is aware of this, they can deactivate the user on their instance but it doesn't avoid such a user to keep spamming other open instances.
 
h3. Suggested Solution:

Add the ability to report users as "spammy" or "abusive" so their Atlassian Account can be reviewed.
fields.summary: Add ability to report abusive users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary:

When searching for a user on user management if a user does not exist, the user has an option to invite the user to the site. When the invite user popup opens the email address is not prefilled. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a sites User Management section and search for a nonexisting email
 # Click on the Invite user
 # The invite user Pop up shows up and the email address field is empty.

h3. Actual behavior:

The email address field in the user invite screen is blank and the user has to reenter the email address
h3. Expected/suggested behavior:

The searched email address is prefilled in the email address field of the invite user screen.
fields.summary: Email account on User Management search box not being copied to Invite user screen

fields.description:
