Avatars are generated by an external service (e.g. i0.wp.com) and need to allow-list certain these domains and IP address ranges to ensure Atlassian cloud products and other services work as expected

h3. Suggested Solution
Generate initials avatar from Jira (without external service).
fields.summary: Generate initials avatar without external service

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, the org admins would not be able to control the profile settings such as Full Name, Public Name, Organization and the view options. It is controlled by the user. 

Specifically with regards to the Public Name, the name is set to be visible by everyone when accessed to the page [https://sitename.atlassian.net/ViewUserHover.jspa?username=|https://vuforia.atlassian.net/ViewUserHover.jspa?username=557058%3A1635c9e1-6ec1-4c5b-b5d1-d4f6bd47bce8] which also displays the current status of the user whether the user is active/inactive. 
h3. Expected Results

There should be control on the "Public name" as well and over all profile settings permission control should be with the org admin. 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Allow org admins to control profile settings

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

You can grant a license to a user by switching the respective product on on the user's page.

Currently, you might receive a misleading message depending on your setup. The message will state that you have reached the maximum number of users for product A, while it should have stated product *B*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Have two products installed on your instance (e.g. Jira Software and Confluence)
* Make sure one of them (e.g. Confluence) has already reached the maximum amount of users
 !Screen Shot 2021-05-13 at 14.28.26.png|thumbnail! 
* Under the *Product access* section, make sure that a group is default for one product, but is also part of the groups that grant product access for the product that has reached its maximum amount of users:
 !Screen Shot 2021-05-13 at 14.28.18.png|thumbnail! 
* On this scenario, I tried granting Jira Software to a user:
 !Screen Shot 2021-05-13 at 14.29.58.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Expected Results

Since the group *2products* is both a default group for Jira Software, and part of the groups that grant Confluence access, the application will show an error stating that you have reached the maximum amount of users for Confluence.

h3. Actual Results

The application shows a message stating that you have reached the maximum amount for the product you had selected instead. On this scenario, Jira Software:
 !Screen Shot 2021-05-13 at 14.18.32.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Misleading error message when trying to apply a license to a user

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, the invitation email only able to set from User Management. From REST API , there are no options.

h3. Suggested Solution
Give options to customer invitation email from create user REST API request.

h3. Workaround
No workaround. User may need to create user via User Management to customize the invitation email
fields.summary: Ability to customize invitation email when user invited/created via REST API

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Upon trying [to invite a user|https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/invite-a-user/] that has its [managed account deactivated|https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/deactivate-a-managed-account/], the following message will be displayed:

{quote}
*Unable to add user@email.com*

We couldn't send your invitation. Try inviting that user again.
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# As an organization administrator, make sure to have a [deactivated managed account|https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/deactivate-a-managed-account/].
# Now, as a site admin, try to [invite this account|https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/invite-a-user/] to a site

h3. Expected Results

The message should state that the account is deactivated, requiring it to be reactivated so it can be invited to the site.

h3. Actual Results
A message asking the user to try again will be displayed:

!message_invite.png|thumbnail!

By inspecting the browser's console, the following can be found:

{code}
{key: "badRequest", context: {message: "Not all users have active AtlassianId account"}}
context: {message: "Not all users have active AtlassianId account"}
key: "badRequest"
{code}

h3. Workaround
For the message, there is no workaround available to change it. However, to complete the invite, [enable the deactivated account to provide site-access|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/enabling-a-deactivated-account-to-provide-site-access-1005792657.html].
fields.summary: Erroneous message when inviting a deactivated account to a site

Create a REST API endpoint to activate/deactivate users based on the *Has access on site* flag:

 !image-2020-06-16-13-44-16-917.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: REST API to activate/deactivate users

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Currently we do not have any API calls to make for revoking the site access of an user.
h3. Suggested Solution

Only possible way is to revoke the site access from the UI
h3. Why This Is Important

This is a feature is helpful when we would want to revoke the site access only of a users and not necessarily remove them from the site (specifically during bulk operations).
h3. Workaround

Revoke the site access from the UI
fields.summary: REST API to revoke site access

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no option to delete groups from the sync and make it a site group without removing the integration. We do have the option to delete the group from *Org* > *Directory* > *User provisioning* but that would also delete it from the site. 

It would be great to have the option to remove a group from the sync so the site/org admins can manage it the way they want. Then, if they need to re-sync that through Google, they can edit the settings and select that group again then [resolve group conflict|https://support.atlassian.com/provisioning-users/docs/resolve-group-conflicts-when-syncing-users/].

h3. Suggested Solutions
Create a feature that allows org admins to remove synced groups from the integration without having to delete the integration nor delete it from the site. The idea is to keep that group and the users within it as a site group so they can manage it and add other users that are not part of the sync.
fields.summary: Improve how G Sync group management works: delete groups from sync without the need of deleting the integration

fields.description:
h3. *Problem:*

When a user account is not managed, site administrators can suggest to the user a new full name and email address.

This option works if the user is active on the site and if they already logged in.

When the user never logged in, the option is visible but it only shows "Something went wrong" if the site administrator tries to suggest the changes.
h3. *Suggestion:*

Remove the option if the user still doesn't have an active Atlassian account and if they never logged in on the site.
fields.summary: Remove "Suggest changes" button if the user never logged in

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Users use the invite teammember from people menu and invite a former user (atlassian account deleted) causes access request to display no access request

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As a user, invite someone who had the Atlassian Account deleted after being invited
# It will display a ghost access request at the site level that cannot be cleared

h3. Expected Results
Display the access request for the former user to clear the access request notification

h3. Actual Results
No access request is displayed and a notification is displayed that there is a pending access request.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Users use the invite teammember from people menu and invite a former user (atlassian account deleted) causes access request to display no access request

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When the SAML integration is removed or stop being enforced for the accounts. The SAML IDs will still be tied to the accounts. This might create some difficulties for those accounts. 

h4. What is SAML ID/Link?
We use SAML IDs (or SAML Links) to connect the accounts between the Identity Provider and Atlassian. These SAML IDs are created when the user first authenticates through the integration and will be associated with the Atlassian account that has the same email address (this validation is done just in the ID creation process). The ID is a combination between {{saml-connection-id}} and {{unique-identifier}} for the account at the IDP. It should look like:
{panel}
{{saml-1234-5678-9\|004yhgdt3}}
{panel} 

h3. Possible issues
Even if that Atlassian Account change to a different email, the ID/Link will still be tied to that one. Below we can see an example:
||account||email||saml link||
|A|abc@domain.com|saml-1234-5678-9\|004yhgdt3|

Account *A* changes to abc-new@domain.com and a new account is created using abc@domain.com, but at the Identity Provider the account is the same:
||account||email||saml link||
|A|abc-new@domain.com|saml-1234-5678-9\|004yhgdt3|
|B|abc@domain.com|(x)|

When the user tries to authenticate with the email abc-new@domain.com, due to the SAML Link, it will be authenticated with account *A*. 

h3. Suggested Solutions
Add to the backend a job that will remove all the SAML IDs/Links from accounts related to that specific integration when the users are not enforced to use it.
fields.summary: Clear the SAML IDs from accounts when the integration stop being enforced

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary



For orgs that use MDM, they cannot restrict logging in to enrolled devices for Atlassian mobile apps. This is required for security & compliance. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # When a user logs in, there is no check for enrolled or unenrolled mobile devices

h3. Expected Results

If a user is logging in, there will be a check if the device is enrolled or unenrolled. For an enrolled device, the user will successfully login. For an unenrolled device, the user will view a message to use an enrolled device and will be unable to login.
h3. Actual Results

For orgs that use MDM, they cannot restrict login to Atlassian products to only enrolled devices. Users can login on an unenrolled device.
fields.summary: Restrict login to enrolled devices for Atlassian mobile apps

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, after user import from Server to Cloud , all the customer account will need to reset their password. The customers need to reset their password on their own , or the admin can update their password one by one from the page.

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be best if the admin is able to update in bulk for all customers account.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: Ability to bulk update customer account at "Portal only customer" page

fields.description: When an account becomes managed, it is still possible for users to change several settings, especially the ones related to public visibility as well as their display name. Some organizations require having total control over the managed accounts, including being able to prevent users from changing their display name and visibility settings and the suggestion is to implement functions to be able to configure what is editable for the user and what is not, from the Org administrators side.
fields.summary: Provide a feature to Org admins to have total control of managed accounts

fields.description:

Some organizations may not see the user count at the overview page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Accessing the https://admin.atlassian.com/o/ORG_ID/overview display the products under that organization and should display the user count of each product.

h3. Expected Results
The user count should be returned at the organization product overview as per the following example:
 !image-2021-04-28-16-16-39-459.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Some organizations may miss the user count from the overview page:
 !image-2021-04-28-16-17-30-009.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Some organizations may not see the user count at the overview page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There are some customers unable to log in. This is the message error:
 !error1.jpg|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access id.atlassian.com or your instance
 # Try to login

h3. Expected Results

Logged-in sucessfully
h3. Actual Results

An error is displayed
h3. Workaround
 # Force logout via [https://id.atlassian.com/logout] (click logout button)

if that does not work you can also try
 # Accesing via incognito mode or
 # Cleaning the cookies
 # Disabling privacy addons / extensions

fields.summary: We couldn't log you in - users unable to login

fields.description:
Hello Team,

It will be of great help if we have a copy button at user management, more specific on the account card, many times we need to copy the user's email that is too large and part of it stays hidden and we need to get back to user list just to copy it,
fields.summary: Create a Copy button on Account card

fields.description: While the *Discovered products* is in place to know which managed user created a new cloud site. Introduce an option in the organization admins would like the option to stop managed users from creating additional cloud sites using the company's email address.
fields.summary: Prevent managed users from creating cloud site using a verified domain.
